reviewText: Very good diverse selection of films, some of which I have not seen in 50 years.
Blast from the past.  You cannot beat this deal.
Too many lame movies in this collection.

No "The Lady Vanishes".  Not a big deal to me but if you are looking for that one in particular be aware that it is NOT included here, despite what the DVD cover says.  I would actually prefer to see 'Beat the Devil' by John Huston so that's a plus, but pretty amateur s*** to list the wrong movie on the box.

OK for the price - but only about two movies worth watching out of the 15 videos.
Comes in two discs and with two DVD covers

I found a better video quality version of these movies on YouTube: Becky Sharp, Vanity Fair, Algiers, They Made Me a Criminal. I didn't look for the others, because I have some of them on Millcreek/Treeline box sets. The image of Beat the Devil was so awful that I stopped after 3 minutes, and found my Treeline version. Treeline is watchable. Hollywood Comedy Legends - 50 Movie Pack The fact that TGG Direct loaded 7 or 8 movies, each 70-100 minutes in length, on one side of a DVD, should be a warning about the (lack of) data provided. I didn't play these recently, but I have them on the packs listed (which I bought 10+ years ago). I Cover the Waterfront and Lady of Burlesque are on Hollywood Legends 50 Movie Pack The Scarlet Letter is on Family Classics 50 Movie Pack Collection The Pied Piper of Hamelin is on Classic Musicals 50 Movie Pack

The Lady Vanishes is not included in the set as it says on the box. Instead is another movie called, 'Beat the Devil' starring Humphrey Bogart.

Most, if not all, of these movies are from the public domain. That doesn't mean they're bad, someone just forgot to renew the rights.

Nice quality for 7 to 8 movies per disc.
